DashStyle Class

In this Article

Represents the sequence of dashes and gaps that will be applied by a Pen.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Windows.Localizability(System.Windows.LocalizationCategory.None, Readability=System.Windows.Readability.Unreadable)]
public sealed class DashStyle : System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • DispatcherObject
  • DependencyObject
  • Freezable
  • System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable
  • DashStyle

Remarks

The Dashes property of this class describes the length of alternating dashes and gaps. The values in the collection are in terms of multiples of the Thickness of the Pen. For example, an array of 1,2 specifies a dash of length (1 * Thickness) followed by a gap of length (2 * Thickness).

Note

The actual length of the dash that is drawn depends on the style of DashCap that is added to each end of the dash. The default DashCap value for a Pen is PenLineCap. This causes an end cap that is one half the thickness of the line to be added onto each end of the pen stroke. (See PenLineCap for an example.) Therefore, if you specify an array of 0, 2 and a square DashCap, the actual dash length will be (0 * Thickness) + (2 * DashCap).

If there are an odd number of values in the collection, the values are interpreted as if they had been repeated once to produce an even number of values. For example, a collection containing 2,3,5 is interpreted the same as a collection containing 2,3,5,2,3,5.

Negative values in the array are interpreted as their absolute value.

Fields

  • DashesProperty

    Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.DashStyle.Dashes* dependency property.

    public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty DashesProperty;
  • OffsetProperty

    Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.DashStyle.Offset* dependency property.

    public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty OffsetProperty;

Properties

  • Dashes

    Gets or sets the collection of dashes and gaps in this DashStyle.

    public System.Windows.Media.DoubleCollection Dashes { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • DoubleCollection

      The collection of dashes and gaps. The default is an empty DoubleCollection.

    Remarks

    This collection describes the length of alternating dashes and gaps. The values in the collection are in terms of multiples of the Thickness of the Pen. For example, an array of 1,2 specifies a dash of length (1 * Thickness) followed by a gap of length (2 * Thickness).

    Note

    The actual length of the dash that is drawn depends on the style of DashCap that is added to each end of the dash. The default DashCap value for a Pen is PenLineCap. This causes an end cap that is one half the thickness of the line to be added onto each end of the pen stroke. (See PenLineCap for an example.) Therefore, if you specify an array of 0, 2 and a square DashCap, the actual dash length will be (0 * Thickness) + (2 * DashCap).

    If there are an odd number of values in the collection, the values are interpreted as if they had been repeated once to produce an even number of values. For example, a collection containing 2,3,5 is interpreted the same as a collection containing 2,3,5,2,3,5.

    Negative values in the array are interpreted as their absolute value.

    Dependency Property Information
    Identifier field DashesProperty
    Metadata properties set to true None

    Example

    The following example shows how to use the DashStyle property of a Pen to create a dashed line under text. 

    <Page xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation" 
  xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" >
  <StackPanel Margin="20">

    <TextBlock FontSize="36">
      the lazy brown dog.
      <TextBlock.TextDecorations>
        <TextDecoration Location="Underline"  
          PenThicknessUnit="FontRecommended">
          <TextDecoration.Pen>
            <Pen Thickness="1.5" Brush="Red" >

              <!-- For the underline, create a dashed line with each
                   dash twice the thickness of the Pen and each gap 8 times
                   the thickness of the Pen. -->
              <Pen.DashStyle>
                <DashStyle Dashes="2,8"/>
              </Pen.DashStyle>
            </Pen>
          </TextDecoration.Pen>
        </TextDecoration>
      </TextBlock.TextDecorations>
    </TextBlock>
  </StackPanel>
</Page>
  • Offset

    Gets or sets how far in the dash sequence the stroke will start.

    public double Offset { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Double

      The offset for the dash sequence. The default is 0.

    Remarks

    It is strongly recommended to use an offset value that resolves to the middle of any dash. This will make most strokes start and end in mid dash rather than at a gap.

    Dependency Property Information
    Identifier field OffsetProperty
    Metadata properties set to true None

Methods

  • Clone()

    Creates a modifiable clone of this DashStyle, making deep copies of this object's values.

    public System.Windows.Media.DashStyle Clone ();

    Returns

    • DashStyle

      A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is true.

    Remarks

    This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

    For more information, see Clone.

    When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

  • CloneCurrentValue()

    Creates a modifiable clone of this DashStyle object, making deep copies of this object's current values.

    public System.Windows.Media.DashStyle CloneCurrentValue ();

    Returns

    • DashStyle

      A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is true.

    Remarks

    This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

    For more information, see CloneCurrentValue.

    Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

  • CreateInstanceCore()
    protected override System.Windows.Freezable CreateInstanceCore ();

    Returns

    • Freezable

      To be added.
